dict.acceptation: 令人困惑的；混乱的；混淆的；
使困窘，使混乱不清(confuse的现在分词)；

sent.orig: Such events as stock splits and reverse splits are always confusing researchers and practitioners.
sent.trans: 股票分拆与并股这类事件一直迷惑着学者和实际工作者。

sent.orig: He is always confusing wheat with leek.
sent.trans: 他对麦苗和韭菜总是辨别不清。

sent.orig: By her own efforts she had managed to make some sense an alien and confusing world.
sent.trans: 通过努力她对这个陌生且迷惑的世界有了一些知识。

sent.orig: Many colleagues found this practice confusing or downright annoying.
sent.trans: 很多同事要么感到很困惑要么就很反感。

sent.orig: These are interesting, lively, but also confusing times in American history as indeed they are everywhere.
sent.trans: 它们正是美国历史中趣味盎然，生气勃勃但却混淆的时代，跟其他地区所处的时代一样。
